name: dieffenbachia
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
any of various plants of a genus (= group) of tropical American evergreen plants (= ones that never lose their leaves), often grown in containers inside a house because of their attractive leaves, although they are poisonous: Dieffenbachia is as common a pot plant in this country as in Western Australia. We recommend caution when presented with a patient exposed to Dieffenbachia. He experimented in the parks, using not just cannas and coleus, but dieffenbachias and even bananas.
More examplesFewer examplesDieffenbachia grows well outdoors in shady spots and indoors as a potted plant.Gift plants like azalea, dieffenbachia, and hyacinth might all be poisonous if eaten.We chose a dieffenbachia plant named Golden Sunset with highly patterned green and yellow-green variegated leaves.
